conversations.content: Whoa, this place is HUGE! I really get the whole room to myself?
Of course. I pray it will keep you in comfort until we are prepared to infiltrate the Jail.
Aw, thanks! Don't know that we'll have much time to relax, though. There's a ton we have to do to get ready.
Then to the extent I may be of assistance, do not hesitate to call upon me.
I gather that your world is quite different from our own, and am certain your mind must be aboil with questions.
It totally is! Okay, so one thing's been  driving me crazy is that I always stock up on medicine and supplies before a Jail run—just to be safe, you know?
But Sophie can't get online to order stuff, and your big medieval castle doesn't seem to have a pharmacy or anything.
On...line? Er, I do not fully ken the extent of your problem, but it seems you seek medicine with which to treat wounds?
Exactly! So is that the sorta thing I could buy if I go to a big enough town here?
Well, yes—but it would be faster to simply forage for healing herbs on your own.
You're telling me you guys have medicine that just...grows out of the ground?!
Er...yes? I take it you do not?
I mean, I guess we sort of do? But no normal person wanders into the woods to pick it for themselves.
Hmm. Perhaps the differences between our worlds are even more fundamental than I first imagined.
In any case, we have skilled herbalists and apothecaries here at the Halidom, so I shall have one assist you in gathering whatever you require.
That'd be a huge help, Elly. Thanks!
It's my pleasure—and again, do not hesitate to ask if there is aught else I might do. Until then, I pray you relax and enjoy your stay here to the utmost.
Aw, Elly's so nice—and so on top of it!
Which means it'd be an insult to NOT kick back and enjoy this sweet room!
...Ugh, nope nope nope. This room is way too big. Besides, I think I'm going through social media withdrawal.
I guess life as normal was never really an option here, so...what now?
...And that's why I'm here. Sorry, Elly. I hope you don't mind me hanging out with you.
There is no need for apologies; if my company will suffice, I am happy for us to spend our hours together.
Sweet! Okay, so I'm super curious to learn more about you. I mean, if you're cool with that, of course.
You wish to learn about...me?
Well, yeah! We're friends now, so I wanna get to know you. Is that not something you guys do here?
No, of course it is. I merely didn't... Yes, anyway, I am happy to share. Perhaps I ought to start at the beginning.
My name is Elisanne, and I am a Paladyn of the Ilian Church.
Neat! Think you could explain some more?
The Ilian Church is an organization that holds great religious sway in this land and works tirelessly to preserve order.
We Paladyns are one of the means by which it does so; we are tasked with protecting the Church's priests and such.
Oh, so you're like a holy bodyguard? That is so cool! I can totally see it.
We've actually got a girl with a similar vibe in the Phantom Thieves.
She's straight-laced, but really nice and super tough. Her code name's Queen.
Alas, I fear I do not deserve to be placed in such esteemed company, for I have failed to live up to the honor of my office.
Recent years have seen a rift develop between my beliefs and the Church's teachings, and I find myself...struggling. Doubting, even.
Oh no.
I don't think going through a rough patch is anything to be ashamed of, though.
Yet I swore an oath.
Okay, so back when I started out as a model, I didn't really give it much thought. I just showed up, struck a few rad poses, and figured that was that.
But, of course, that was super naive of me. Soon enough, I hit a wall. Doubted myself, struggled to continue, all of it.
But I made it through. And because I did, I gained the strength to totally recommit to my career as a model.
So don't ever feel bad for having doubts! They're just a sign of how you're thinking and growing as a person, you know?
...Thank you, Panther. Your words have brought me great comfort this day.
You are a remarkable woman; very few have the poise to turn their greatest struggles into a strength.
Oh stop, you're gonna make me blush!
I might have made it sound cool, but all that really happened was I realized how  lame it was to not be committing myself to my modeling.
I am most unfamiliar with the art world, and did not understand the resolve required of those who sit for portraits.
Huh? Sorry, not that kind of model... Not after that one time. I'm talking about photos. Magazines. Editorial content, y'know?
...Which I can see from your face is not stuff that you have around here. Well then, let me tell you a bit about my world now!
I am most eager to hear any stories you are willing to share.
Well, I hope your evening's free, because I'm ready to talk all night!
Whoa! You guys really do have all sorts of dragons around here!
I expect this is your first time seeing one, as your world apparently lacks them.
Yep! Well, never seen a real one, anyway. We did get to see a fake one recently though... That was, uhh, something...
A fake dragon?
Yeah, don't worry about it.
Hey, that song is beautiful! Who's singing?
That would be Siren. She is a dragon who can enchant people with her voice.
You're telling me a DRAGON is singing?!
If you are curious, you can pay her a visit.
Already on my way! See ya, Elly! Good luck with spear practice!
SI-REN! SI-REN!
Wild... It's like an idol concert!
Thanks for coming out today, guys! See ya next time!
WE LOVE YOU!
Wow, that crowd adored you! If you aren't the top idol here, you've gotta be close.
Hm? What did you just call me?
Er, an idol? Is that not...?
Oh. Right. I guess that's not what they call folks like you in this world.
Oh, WAIT! I totes get it now!
You're that thief person who came here from another world and junk!
That's me, all right! Call me Panther. It's lovely to meet you!
And I'm Siren! But hang on, go back. Why am I an idol again?
Okay, so idols are performers who sing and dance and light up the stage. They're cheerful and sparkly and...um...
Basically, they're all about putting smiles on people's faces when life's got them feeling low. Does that make sense?
Oh my gosh, that is TOTALLY me! I love making people happy by singing and dancing.
Wait, so are YOU an idol?
Me? No, I'm a model...which, saying that probably doesn't help you out one bit. Anyway, no. Not an idol.
Oh, boo. I was thinking you could maybe teach me what you know and stuff.
Aw, sorry, Siren. Oh, but I CAN help you out on your pose game!
That stuff is kind of a model's whole deal.
Yay! Then show me how to strike a super cool pose that'll make the whole crowd stand up and be all ＂wooooo＂!
In that case, here's the surefire secret to next-level posing...
Rule number one: Put life and intention into every inch, down to the fingertips!
Do you flare them out straight? Give them that gentle sort of curve? Lazy fingers can ruin a whole look!
I see! So like, um...this?
Oh yeah, I love that!
Rule number two: the gaze! A slight smile in the eyes changes a whole expression.
Wow. I never thought of that before.
Well, I hope it's been helpful.
That was super educational! Thanks!
But now you gotta let me give you some song and dance tips, 'kay?!
Hit me with it! That can only help with my modeling career.
Okay, so the thing to watch out for with a step like this is...
Oh, wow. So it's like...this?
(This is so much fun!)
(I never dreamed I'd make friends with a dragon, let alone get a dance lesson! I think I could get the hang of this crazy place!)
Bingo! This is the herb you're looking for.
Thanks, Luca. Time to stock up!
I was going crazy thinking of how to get medicine with no drugstores around.
I guess stuff like medicinal herbs really does just pop out of the ground if you know how to look for it.
Especially if you've got a sylvan like me to guide you. We're the children of the forest, after all!
Anyway, there should be tons of this stuff growing further in, so let's check it out.
Uh, is that safe? Won't we get lost?
Ha! These woods are practically my backyard! Now c'mon, let's go.
Well, if you're sure...
Right side...clear. Left side...clear.
Uh, so what are you expecting to jump out at you from behind a tree, exactly?
We're way far from Emile's Jail out here, and isn't that where the Shadows are?
Yeah, but there could still be fiends out here, right?
I feel like all kinds of scary stuff could turn up in woods like this...
Yeaaah, I think we're probably fine? I don't see any signs of anything like that.
No tracks, no broken branches... Shouldn't be anything too dangerous around.
Okay. I trust you, I guess...
But look what IS out here, Panther!
More herbs?
Even better—it's an APPLE! Doesn't it look amazing?
Well yeah, but we're not here to find snacks.
Yeah, but if we pass this baby up, we'll DEFINITELY regret it.
Forget juicy—this sucker's fit to burst! You ever seen a more tempting apple?
*sigh* It looks like every other apple I've ever seen. Why are you making such a...
Actually, wait. It DOES look good! Almost...hypnotically good.
Starting to see the light, huh? Here, I'll cut you half.
You sure!? Thanks! Well then, don't mind me... *chomp*
So sweet! So juicy! So crisp! It's... It's perfect!
I love a nice cake loaded with icing and whipped cream, but it's hard to beat this kind of fresh, natural sweetness.
This apple is seriously changing my life.
This patch of woods must be dense with good mana.
Sorry, mana?
Oh, right. New thing for you.
Okay, so mana is... Um... Huh... Well, I guess this apple tastes good because this place is overflowing with nature's blessing.
Hold on. If the whole area's full of nature's blessing...
Then ALL the apples here taste like that?!
They should, yeah—which is why we're bringing a ton home with us.
Heck yeah! Let's see if we can convince Cleo to bake something for us!
Look at this haul! I can't even carry them all!
Everybody's eyes are gonna fall out of their heads when we walk in the door.
Right?! Let's hurry back and show them!
...Hold up. Are we forgetting something?
Now that you mention it, it does kinda feel like that. Something important...
AH!
We totally forgot about the herbs!
Dammit! I got too caught up with apples! Now it's gonna be dark soon, and even I don't wanna be here when that happens.
Quick, let's grab all the herbs we can!
Stupid delicious apples! This place is deadlier than any Jail!
On the way back to the Halidom after dispatching a pack of fiends, Panther and her friends stop by a small village to seek shelter for the night...
Oh, but this is terrible! What to do, what to do...?
The people here look pretty bummed out. I wonder what happened?
Hello, travelers. Are you new here?
Sure are. We were hoping to find a place to spend the night, but, uh...
Well, it seems like you guys have more pressing concerns. What's going on?
I fear a dragon recently arrived at our village out of the blue and demanded... a human sacrifice.
What?! You guys told me dragons were your friends!
Plus, all the ones I met at the Halidom were super nice. Definitely didn't seem like the human sacrifice kinda folks.
There are all kinds of dragons, just like there are all kinds of people—and some of 'em aren't the biggest fans of humans.
Well, sure...but can't we talk them out of it?
No! What if you anger it?!
Oh, right. Wouldn't really help if the huge dragon went on a rampage, huh.
You misunderstand, Panther. People in this world—and especially we humans— worship dragons.
They are masters of nature and mana, which makes them special among all living things. But as they bring bounty, they can also rain down wrath.
Even a child knows that without dragons, our fields would wither and our rivers rot!
We're at their mercy, and we've no choice save to obey them and pray for clemency.
So if some dragon stomps over and tells you to start feeding it your friends, you just lie down and do it?!
Such is the natural law and reality of our world, as grim as it might seem.
I mean, I get that it's a rule, but...
(...But an outsider like me should probably just keep her big mouth shut.)
(Still, is that really the right thing to do?)
Huh? What are those two doing?
No, you have to live! That's why I'm going to offer myself up in your place!
No! I was the one who got chosen; there's no reason you should die!
How can I live with myself if I let my best friend die in order to save me?!
(Oh no... They're just like I was!)
(I was trying to sacrifice myself for Shiho, and Shiho was doing the same for me...)
(We both told ourselves it didn't matter what happened to us so long as our friend was safe...)
Okay, that does it! I'm gonna go tell this stupid dragon to knock it off already!
And nobody better try to stop me! Even if I go alone, I have to—
Stop you? I'm coming WITH you!
Huh? But I thought... What happened to ＂this world's natural law＂ and all that?
Do I seriously strike you as the kinda guy who cares about the rules?
I've got a thing or nine I wanna say to this dragon, so I'm right behind you!
Both of you, listen to reason and... *sigh* I should know better than to try by now. In that case, let us all go together.
Someone needs to be there to prevent matters from truly getting out of hand.
Thanks, guys! I feel way better knowing you've got my back in all this.
Hey, dragon! You in there, buddy? Come on out for a second, yeah?
(Ugh, that thing's even scarier than I was expecting!)
(But now's not the time to be afraid. I need to really let this thing have it!)
Er, excuse me? Yeah, you there. We need to talk to you a minute!
You have business with Stribog? Very well. Then you are most welcome here.
Now see here! We're...uh... Wow. I didn't expect you to sound like such a gentleman.
Yeah, I figured a dragon who demanded human sacrifices would be a little more... you know. Rough and tumble?
I beg your pardon? Human sacrifice?
Yeah, you told the village they had to give you a human sacrifice! ...Didn't you?
Hm? While I did visit the village recently, I certainly demanded nothing of the sort.
Oh, well that's great news! They must have just misunderstood you.
Perhaps they did, at that. For you see, while I have dwelled within this cave in thoughtful meditation since antiquity, the other day brought forth epiphany.
Might not conversation with those unlike me—and specifically with children of men—yield insights that introspection alone cannot?
But when you requested a conversation partner, the villagers jumped to the conclusion that you were demanding blood sacrifice.
They didn't jump to a conclusion so much as hurl themselves off a cliff of conclusion, but sure. Whatever.
They must have been so startled to see this guy that they panicked.
(I was pretty terrified too, after all...)
Hmm? What's wrong, Panther?
Nothing, I'm good. But we should hurry back to the village and clear things up.
It's back! The dragon is back!
I didn't expect it to be so soon...but I have to do this! I have to keep everyone safe!
No! If someone has to be sacrificed, let it be me!
Everybody just hold on for a second! The dragon doesn't want a sacrifice!
It's all in your heads, ya weirdos!
...What do you mean?
Phew, glad we ironed that all out.
Indeed, I am relieved our words were able to calm the villagers to the point where they could hear Stribog out.
I owe you my thanks for your aid; the villagers and I arrived at a swift arrangement as a result.
They will send conversation partners in shifts to my dwelling, a development for which I am most grateful.
I'm glad it all worked out!
And I'm glad for you two as well.
*sniffle* Oh, what a relief!
I know! Now we have so much more time to spend together!
(There's no treasure quite like the time you spend with your friends.)
(Right, Shiho?)
Something on your mind, Panther?
Oh, hey, Joker. Nah, it's nothing serious.
It's just that when we first got here, everything felt so different from home. I didn't know what to think.
I mean, real princes? Real dragons? This humongous castle?
Yeah, it's a lot.
Honestly, I was a little shaken up. I wasn't even sure I could deal with it.
But then I talked to the people here, and they were all a hundred percent open and accepting.
Like, Elly is just so nice...
I got to geek out about idols and modeling with a dragon named Siren...
Luca was super helpful—and also kind of not, but in a really fun way.
I got to see this world and get to know it at the same time I was getting to know all of them.
And that made something really clear:
Our worlds might be completely different, but people are always the same no matter where you are.
Everyone's got their own worries. Their own pain.
And yeah, sometimes you feel like the whole world is crashing down on you and there's nothing you can do about it...
But everyone still lives their lives as best they can, and I think that's the same no matter what world you come from.
So I don't really feel like the deal we made is what's keeping me going—I want to help these people because I LIKE them.
And I want to stop Emile from stealing the Desires of these people who are just trying to live their lives the best they can!
Anyway, that's what I was thinking about. Just a little pep talk for myself, I guess.
That's very you, Panther.
Heh, thanks. Oh, and thanks for always giving me a little push to follow my heart!
I wouldn't want anyone else in my corner in a fight, 'cause together, the Phantom Thieves are unbeatable!
It's not just us anymore, either.
Huh?
They're part of the team now, too.
Ah, there you two are.
We're prepared to hit Emile's Jail. Are you ready to go?
You bet.
You're right, Joker: We've got the whole Halidom in our corner now!
I'm ready to go, Euden!
It's time for the Phantom Thieves and the people of the Halidom to fight for everyone in this world!
